title: 26 Cheap (But Expensive-Looking) Chairs You Can Buy on Amazon
text:
Photo: Courtesy of the retailers.

We love things that look expensive, and we really love things that look expensive but aren’t (like things for kitchens, bedrooms, and bathrooms). Today, we turn our attention to chairs, because we all need more seating. You can get extremely cheap chairs and extremely expensive ones, but we set ourselves a limit of $150 (or thereabouts, making exceptions for a few that were too good to exclude). These are options for sprucing up a dining table, a bar counter, or a living room, because it’s time to put those overworked Ikea chairs out of their misery.

Living room chairs

Flash Furniture Beech Bentwood Chairs We think these would look cool as a pair around a similarly curved-shaped coffee table. Or, put one in your living room and tuck another in a corner of your dining room to create some symmetry throughout the house. $206 for 2 at Amazon Buy $206 for 2 at Amazon Buy

Home TopGo Ball Chair It may not be the coziest to sit on, but this bright orange fiberglass stool-chair will definitely brighten up a room. $135 at Amazon Buy $135 at Amazon Buy

Armen Living Summer Chair in Charcoal Fabric and Walnut Wood Finish $106 (was $237, now 55% off) This mid-century-style accent chair has undeniable Mad Men vibes. $106 at Amazon Buy $106 at Amazon Buy

Duhome Design Dining Chair/Accent Chair with Metal Frame Legs and Velvet Seat, Rose This velvety, rose-colored scoop chair would be particularly elegant in the corner of a bedroom. (Bonus: the open back can serve as a deterrent from letting clothes pile up). $100 at Amazon Buy $100 at Amazon Buy

Armchairs

Roundhill Furniture Tuchico Contemporary Fabric Chair, Tan $111 (was $145, now 23% off) The seat is big and cushy, but the slim wooden legs and light-colored fabric let it blend in without feeling like it’s taking up too much space. $111 at Amazon Buy $111 at Amazon Buy

Modern Design Fabric Chair w/Solid Wood Leg, Teal $90 (was $100, now 10% off) We’re very into accent chairs in vibrant colors. This one has a bold shape, but it still looks like something you’d actually want to sit in. $90 at Amazon Buy $90 at Amazon Buy

HomePop Velvet Swoop Arm Chair, Dark Green $154 (was $200, now 23% off) If you’ve ever lived in an apartment with roommates, there’s always that one super comfortable chair that’s always been there and no one knows where it came from. This is like that chair, but brand-new. (Think Monica Geller’s apartment aesthetic). $154 at Amazon Buy $154 at Amazon Buy

Dining room chairs

Safavieh Home Bernice Natural Cane Dining Chair Adding some cane to your dining room will give the room some texture and warmth, not to mention that the material is having a moment. $180 at Amazon Buy $180 at Amazon Buy

angelo:HOME Asti Collection Dining Chair Yes, these are also part of the mid-century trend, but the walnut wood and kind of geometric shape set them apart from more ubiquitous MCM styles. $130 for 2 at Amazon Buy $130 for 2 at Amazon Buy

Sandra Grey Fabric with Oak Finish Mid Century Modern Dining Chairs (Set of 2) A set of two Scandinavian-style dining chairs that look like they should cost double the list price. $120 for 2 at Amazon Buy $120 for 2 at Amazon Buy

Poly and Bark Burton Side Chair in Clear (Set of 2) Clear plastic chairs (okay, ghost chair look-alikes): They match anything and are easy to clean. $127 at Amazon Buy $127 at Amazon Buy

Rivet Florence Mid-Century Wide Open-Back Accent Dining Chairs (Set of 2) These blue, open-backed chairs would work anywhere, and the black wooden legs are a little more subtle than the typical exposed woodgrain. $149 at Amazon Buy $149 at Amazon Buy

EGGREE Mid Century Modern Accent Living Room Chairs (Set of 2), Velvet, Purple We love these velvet accent chairs. They could make for a stylish dining chair set if you’re not worried about spilling food on the pastel purple fabric. $110 at Amazon Buy $110 at Amazon Buy

Stools

ROBTLE Anti-Slip Bentwood Stool If four stools sounds like too many, try one in a springy green (it also comes in Necco-wafer pink). $22 at Amazon Buy $22 at Amazon Buy

VASAGLE Shoe Bench And if you’re going to ask your guests to take their shoes off, at least let them do so in style on this very affordable mid-century-inspired bench. $56 at Amazon Buy $56 at Amazon Buy

Topeakmart 17.3” Tall Nesting Plastic Stack Stools Blue/Green/Red/White/Yellow (Set of 5, Multicolored) A set of five nesting stools in different colors. (Sure, they’re a little kindergarten-y, but as long as you don’t pair them with a sandbox and wooden blocks, you should be fine). $59 at Amazon Buy $59 at Amazon Buy

Euro Style Sallie Modern Stool, White $45 (was $46, now 2% off) An abstract, hourglass-shaped stool that doubles as an end table. It’s made from durable ABS plastic so it would work outside, too. $45 at Amazon Buy $45 at Amazon Buy

get the strategist newsletter Actually good deals, smart shopping advice, and exclusive discounts. Email Terms & Privacy Notice By submitting your email, you agree to our Terms and Privacy Notice and to receive email correspondence from us.

The Strategist is designed to surface the most useful, expert recommendations for things to buy across the vast e-commerce landscape. Some of our latest conquests include the best acne treatments, rolling luggage, pillows for side sleepers, natural anxiety remedies, and bath towels. We update links when possible, but note that deals can expire and all prices are subject to change.

Every editorial product is independently selected. If you buy something through our links, New York may earn an affiliate commission.
description: We scoured Amazon to find all the best living room and dining chairs priced around $150. Including mid-century modern dupes, ghost chair look-alikes, a green velvet armchair, cane dining chairs, and Rachel Ashwell and Design Within Reach look-alikes.
